intro: Phymatodes simplex, commonly known as the Texas starburst, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a star-like pattern, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, and the plant has a shallow root system adapted to arid conditions. Phymatodes simplex is also known for its ability to form dense colonies, which can stabilize soil in degraded landscapes.
